org.openstreetmap.osm.data.mysql
Class ConstrainedCurrentWayReader

java.lang.Object
  org.openstreetmap.osm.data.mysql.ConstrainedBaseReader<Way>
      org.openstreetmap.osm.data.mysql.ConstrainedCurrentWayReader
All Implemented Interfaces:
Releasable, ReleasableIterator<Way>, java.util.Iterator<Way>
public class ConstrainedCurrentWayReader
extends ConstrainedBaseReader<Way>

This is a reimplementation of CurrentWayReader that is supposed to return only a fraction of the database.

Author:
Marcus Wolschon

ConstrainedCurrentWayReader

public ConstrainedCurrentWayReader(DatabaseLoginCredentials aLoginCredentials)
This constructor creates an instance that will read ALL ways of the database.

Parameters:
aLoginCredentials - the database and -login we use.

ConstrainedCurrentWayReader

public ConstrainedCurrentWayReader(DatabaseLoginCredentials aLoginCredentials,
                                   double aminLat,
                                   double aminLon,
                                   double amaxLat,
                                   double amaxLon)
This constructor creates an instance that will read ALL ways of the database that are within a bounding-box.

Parameters:
aLoginCredentials - the database and -login we use.
aminLat - only the elements within/intersecting this bounding-box will be returned
amaxLat - only the elements within/intersecting this bounding-box will be returned
aminLon - only the elements within/intersecting this bounding-box will be returned
amaxLon - only the elements within/intersecting this bounding-box will be returned

ConstrainedCurrentWayReader

public ConstrainedCurrentWayReader(DatabaseLoginCredentials aLoginCredentials,
                                   long aNodeID)
Parameters:
aLoginCredentials - the database and -login we use.
aNodeID - the id of the single node we want fetch from the ways for the db.

ConstrainedCurrentWayReader

public ConstrainedCurrentWayReader(DatabaseLoginCredentials aLoginCredentials,
                                   java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> aTags,
                                   ConstrainedCurrentNodeReader.CONDITION aOr,
                                   ConstrainedCurrentNodeReader.COMPARESTYLE aLike,
                                   double aminLat,
                                   double aminLon,
                                   double amaxLat,
                                   double amaxLon)
Creates a new instance that will read all ways that have tags matching the given condition.

Parameters:
aLoginCredentials - Contains all information required to connect to the database.
aTags - name-value -pairs
aOr - combine the different values in aTags via AND or via OR.
aLike - compare the names and values via SQL-"like" or literaly
aminLat - only the elements within/intersecting this bounding-box will be returned
amaxLat - only the elements within/intersecting this bounding-box will be returned
aminLon - only the elements within/intersecting this bounding-box will be returned
amaxLon - only the elements within/intersecting this bounding-box will be returned

aTags - name-value -pairs
aOr - combine the different values in aTags via AND or via OR.
aLike - compare the names and values via SQL-"like" or literaly
Method Detail

reInitialize

public void reInitialize(double aminLat,
                         double aminLon,
                         double amaxLat,
                         double amaxLon)
Re-initialize this class to read ALL ways of the database that are within a bounding-box using ths still open database-connections.

Parameters:
aminLat - only the elements within/intersecting this bounding-box will be returned
amaxLat - only the elements within/intersecting this bounding-box will be returned
aminLon - only the elements within/intersecting this bounding-box will be returned
amaxLon - only the elements within/intersecting this bounding-box will be returned

reInitializeForNode

public void reInitializeForNode(long aNodeID)
Re-initialize this class to read one way from the database that contains the given node using ths still open database-connections.

Parameters:
aNodeID - the id of the single node we want fetch from the ways for the db.

getNext

public Way getNext()
This method is the actual implementation of Iterator.next(). It is called by ConstrainedBaseReader.next() after that function did some housekeeping on our state..

Specified by:
getNext in class ConstrainedBaseReader<Way>
Returns:
the next element of the iterator or null.
See Also:
Iterator.next()
